caption.p: Analysis of host-virus interactions was performed using the interactomes of human protein with HIV, dengue and human influenza (details in Methods section). The networks of interactions are shown in ( A– C) with the host and viral proteins represented in cyan and red colors respectively. The number of viral proteins any given human protein is interacting with is denoted as the node-degree (viral) and the number of such proteins in the interactome are indicated on the y-axis in ( D– F). HIV has the highest number of proteins interacting with a single viral protein and dengue has the largest number of host proteins interacting with more than one viral protein.
